attributes.action: Ban the Shooting of Ptarmigans (Lagopus muta) as Game Birds
attributes.additional_details: Ptarmigans are red-listed birds restricted to high altitudes in the North-West highlands of Scotland. They are in severe decline and are one of the species most in need of conservation efforts. The RSPB estimates that their population could be as low as 2000 individuals. They used to inhabit the southern uplands and lake district, but they are now extinct in England and heading for extinction in Scotland due to humans and climate change. It makes no sense to anyone to hunt endangered species.
attributes.background: Pass a law to make the shooting of Ptarmigans as game birds illegal to prevent their extinction in the UK.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government and Scottish Parliament is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: https://petitions.parliament.scot/

You may also wish to contact your local council and MSP who represent you about this issue. 

You can find the name of your local council and how to contact them here: https://www.mygov.scot/find-your-local-council

You can find the name of your local MSP and how to contact them here: https://www.parliament.scot/msps
